description: Users need to know what all the options are, and know straight away how to access them. In the case of websites, this is an easy win.
Every action needs a reaction. There needs to be some indication, like a sound, a moving dial, a spinning rainbow wheel, that the userâ€™s action caused something.
Affordance is the relationship between what something looks like and how it's used.
Mapping is the relationship between control and effect. The idea is that with good design, the controls will closely resemble what they affect.
Constraints are the limits to an interaction or an interface.
Some are really obvious and physical, others are more nuanced.
The same action has to cause the same reaction, every time; even if you switch from one interface to another, or one website/page to another.
